meanings.definition: To format or prepare something in advance.
meanings.sent1: I need to preformat the document before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She always preformats her presentations to save time.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to preformat their essays for a smoother review process.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous planning allowed him to preformat the project flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: Remember to preformat your resume before sending it out for job applications.

meanings.sent1: The preformat file was ready for printing.
meanings.sent2: We received a preformat schedule for the event.
meanings.sent3: The preformat instructions made the task seem easier than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her preformat notes were organized and easy to follow.
meanings.sent5: The preformat layout of the website was clean and user-friendly.
